data: ENT Laryngectomy - Elective Post Operative Fast Track (Multiphase)
Nurse to initiate the Surgeon Immediate Post Operative phase.  These orders continue on the inpatient unit
Discontinue ENT Otolaryngology Pre-Operative (Day of Surgery) Powerplan
Initiate Fast Track Total Larygectomy Clinical Pathway
Special Instructions: Insert LaryTube/Heat Moisture Exchanger (HME) POD #0, HME: Yes
Special Instructions: Insert LaryTube/Heat Moisture Exchanger (HME) POD #1, HME: Yes
Special instructions: Laryngectomy stoma care as per protocol: LaryTube care and HME changes
For a new fever greater than 38.5 DegC
Sodium chloride 0.9% (NS) mouth rinses q4h and PRN while awake
Emergency trach equipment at beside/ accompany patient at all times
Suction catheter, staple remover, suture scissors and suction at HOB at all times
Do not remove NG tube or Entriflex tube - required for insertion of voice prosthesis
Ensure NG tube/Entriflex tube is sutured and/or secured to the patient at all times and verify and document depth of insertion
Flush with 25 mL of water q4h
Measure urinary output q4h for 24 hour, then q6h until catheter discontinued. Notify provider if urine output is less than 30 mL/h
Strip hemovac tubing q1h for 4 hours then q6h PRN. Empty/record output q6h and PRN
Assess Doppler Signal, site: No visible skin paddle
Sodium chloride 0.9% oral rinses q4h and PRN while awake
Neurovascular assessment to flap donor site q4h for 3 days, then qshift and PRN
Elevate donor site on pillow to prevent edema
T+5;N, Site: Donor Site, Physician to remove slab cast. Once removed: Apply protective dressing: jelonet, abdominal pad, wrap with kling. Continue until dry then can be OTA
Post Op Day 0. Dangle and mobilize to chair
T+1;N, Goal is to walk full circuit of nursing unit x 2
1 application, topical, BID, order duration: 7 day, drug form: oint

If patient unable to tolerate PO/NG, select ceFAZolin AND metroNIDAZOLE. 
If patient able to tolerate PO/NG, select amoxicillin-clavulanate

ceFAZolin can be safely administered to patients with penicillin allergy, including anaphylaxis. Do NOT administer if severe delayed skin reaction to any beta-lactam (e.g. drug reaction with eosinophilia and systemic symptoms, Stevens-Johnson syndrome, toxic epidermal necrolysis)
1,000 mg, IV, q8h, order duration: 5 day, drug form: bag
500 mg, IV, q12h, order duration: 5 day, drug form: bag
amoxicillin-clavulanate 875 mg-125 mg tab (dosed as amoxicillin)
875 mg, NG-tube, BID, order duration: 5 day, drug form: tab
875 mg, PO, BID, order duration: 5 day, drug form: tab
If ceFAZolin allergic or contraindicated, select vancomycin AND metroNIDAZOLE
1,000 mg, IV, q12h, order duration: 5 day
500 mg, IV, q12h, order duration: 5 day, drug form: bag
500 mg, PO, BID, order duration: 5 day, drug form: tab
500 mg, NG-tube, BID, order duration: 5 day, drug form: tab
If suspected or documented Pseudomonas colonization, ADD ciprofloxacin
400 mg, IV, q12h, order duration: 5 day, drug form: bag
500 mg, PO, BID, order duration: 5 day, drug form: tab
500 mg, NG-tube, BID, order duration: 5 day, drug form: tab
Blood, STAT, Unit collect, Collection: T;N, once
Blood, STAT, Unit collect, Collection: T;N, once
Blood, STAT, Unit collect, Collection: T;N, once
Blood, STAT, Unit collect, Collection: T;N, once
Blood, Timed, Unit collect, collection: T;N+480,  q8h interval for 2 doses or times
Blood, Timed, Unit collect, collection: T;N+480,  q8h interval for 2 doses or times
Blood, STAT, Unit collect, Collection: T;N, once
Blood, STAT, Unit collect, Collection: T;N, once
Blood, STAT, Unit collect, Collection: T;N, once
Blood, STAT, Unit collect, Collection: T;N, once
Humidified air to laryngeal stoma until LaryTube inserted
Titrate O2 to keep SpO2 92% or greater
Titrate O2 to keep SpO2 88 - 92 %, for COPD patients
T;N, Routine, Special Instructions: To confirm NG tube placement, in PACU
Inpatient Nurse to initiate the Surgeon Post Operative (Floor) phase of this plan
Patient to make follow up appointment with Surgeon in 1 week
Patient to make follow up appointment with Surgeon in 2 weeks
Patient to make follow up appointment with SLP in 1 week (if voice prosthesis not inserted - patient to go home with entriflex in place)
Patient to make follow up appointment with SLP in 2 weeks (if voice prosthesis not inserted - patient to go home with entriflex in place)
q1h for 2 hour, then q4h for 24 hour, then q6h for 24 hour, post-op day 1, then q8h for 24 hour, post-op day 2, then q12h for 24 hour, post-op day 3, then qdaily until discharge
q1h for 2 hour, then  q4h for 24 hour, then q6h for 24 hours, post-op day 1, then q8h for 24 hours, post-op day 2, then q12h for 24 hours, post-op day 3, then qdaily until discharge
Initiate iCOUGH protocol as per guideline, if applicable
Start Laryngectomy teaching Post Op Day 1
T+1;0600, Special Instructions: After removing Foley, patient to void at intervals no greater than 6 hours; measure post void residuals x 2 and PRN
NPO until Gastrografin Swallow Assessment completed
Isosource 1.2, Start Rate (mL/h): 25, Goal Rate (mL/h): 25, Closed System: No, Flush with Water, Flush with (mL) 25, Flush frequency: q4h, Start tube feeds once entriflex tube placement confirmed
Total hourly fluid intake 100 mL/h, Including feeds, Including IV fluids
order rate: 75 mL/h, IV, drug form: bag
order rate: 100 mL/h, IV, drug form: bag
order rate: 125 mL/h, IV, drug form: bag
order rate: 75 mL/h, IV, drug form: bag
order rate: 100 mL/h, IV, drug form: bag
order rate: 125 mL/h, IV, drug form: bag
order rate: See most recent TFI orders IV, drug form: bag
When tolerating oral intake greater than or equal to 600 mL / 12 hour
Insulin Subcutaneous for Patients Eating or NPO (Sliding Scale) (Module)
Insulin Subcutaneous for Patients on TPN or Continuous Enteral Feeds (Sliding Scale) (Module)
Blood, AM Draw, Collection: T+1;0330, qdaily for 5 day
Blood, AM Draw, Collection: T+1;0330, qdaily for 5 day
Blood, AM Draw, Collection: T+2;0330, qdaily for 4 day
Blood, AM Draw, Collection: T+2;0330, qdaily for 4 day
Blood, AM Draw, Collection: T+1;0330, once
Blood, AM Draw, Collection: T+1;0330, once
Routine, Special Instructions: Schedule on post-op day 3
Routine, Special Instructions: Schedule on post-op day 5
Routine, Special Instructions: Schedule on post-op day 7
Routine, Special Instructions: Schedule on post-op day 10
Consider consultation with Anesthesia, Psychiatry, Respirology, Endocrinology
Reason for Consult: Neck dissection exercises and ambulation
Reason for Consult: Neck dissection exercises, Donor exercises and ambulation
Reason for Consult: TEP Valve and Swallowing Assessment, Notify re: patient admission and possible insertion of voice prosthesis on Post op day 5
Reason for Consult: TEP Valve and Swallowing Assessment, Notify re: patient admission and possible insertion of voice prosthesis on Post op day 4
Reason for Consult: TEP Valve and Swallowing Assessment, Notify re: patient admission and possible insertion of voice prosthesis on Post op day 6
Reason for Consult: TEP Valve and Swallowing Assessment, Notify re: patient admission and possible insertion of voice prosthesis on Post op day 8
Reason for Consult: TEP Valve and Swallowing Assessment, Notify re: patient admission and possible insertion of voice prosthesis on Post op day 10
Reason for Consult: TEP Valve and Swallowing Assessment, Notify re: patient admission and possible insertion of voice prosthesis on Post op day 12
